content:
#9544 removes most nat subtraction lemmas that are special cases of the has_ordered_sub lemmas. The remaining ones will be done in a subsequent (much smaller) PR.
It would be great if this could be reviewed quickly because it rots very easily (I already had 1 conflict since yesterday).
The commit message contains some information that should make it easier to update other PRs/projects because of this commit.
Does it change significantly the import graph?
The PR does not change any import.
Sebastien is right. This only changes the name of some lemmas (generally from nat.foo to foo or name_similar_to_foo')
Ok, I wanted to merge it but Sébastien was faster
(Note that builds are not triggering right now. I think this is due to some current GitHub actions issues.)
Thanks for this! I'm very much looking forward to having less and less nat-specific lemmas.
Who wants to do the same to ennreal?
I'd happily carry it out if I have time (but term started so that's much more hypothetical than last week).
I'm going through multiple PRs doing this for different types. ennreal is on the list.
#9544 is ready to be merged again

Yury G. Kudryashov said:

Who wants to do the same to ennreal?

#9582
This is the PR that should break (almost) nothing in the rest of the library. A subsequent PR will remove all lemmas that are now obsolete.
